DataVisualizer Class Reference

Displays all known chemical elements in a two-dimensional viewport organized by one of their property, selected by the user. More...

#include <datavisualizer.h>

 Shows this data visualization window to the user and selects the first property to display initially.

Detailed Description

Displays all known chemical elements in a two-dimensional viewport organized by one of their property, selected by the user.

void DataVisualizer::draw ( SceneType  scene,
qreal &  lastXPos,
Element::Ptr  e,
int  propertyIndex 
) [private]

Draws the selected property of an element to the scene in a way that it doesn't overlap with other items.

Parameters:
[in,out] scene The QGraphicsScene to draw to.
[in,out] lastXPos Position in x direction of the last element drawed. Assumes, the items are sorted by the selected property in ascending order.
[in] e The Element whose property should be drawn.
[in] propertyIndex The index of the element property to draw.
See also:

void DataVisualizer::emitElementLinkActivated ( const QString &  link  )  [private, slot]

Signal forwarder to display element details in the mainwindow.

Is called by every single item drawn in the graphics scene.

[in] link The link text.

QString DataVisualizer::getLinkText ( const cfp::ChemicalElementInterface &  e  )  [static]

Generate a link text for the specified element to display detailed element data in the mainwindow.

Example for H4: 

 <style>a{text-decoration:none;}</style><a href="H">H<sub>4</sub></a>

Example for O: 

 <style>a{text-decoration:none;}</style><a href="O">O</a>
Parameters:
[in] e The chemical element to generate a link for.
Returns:
The link text.
See also:
MainWindow::showElementData(const QString& key)

void DataVisualizer::setItemPos ( QGraphicsItem *  item,
QPointF  pos 
) [private]

Sets the position of an item in a graphics scene in a way it doesn't collide or overlap with other items.

Parameters:
[in,out] item The item to position in the scene.
[in] pos The desired position of the item. To avoid overlapping, it is changed in vertical direction (y) only.
